article_metadata.description: Contemporary statutes creep increasingly close to the reductio ad absurdum provided by Scalia 25 years ago, whereby Congress votes all power to the President and adjourns. The ACA is an example, and Dodd-Frank might be even worse.
article_metadata.author: JV DeLong

og.description: Contemporary statutes creep increasingly close to the reductio ad absurdum provided by Scalia 25 years ago, whereby Congress votes all power to the President and adjourns. The ACA is an example, and Dodd-Frank might be even worse.
og.title: ObamaCare, Chevron And Congressional Delegation
